intro: Bulbinella gracilis, commonly known as the slender rock lily, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the base of the stems. Bulbinella gracilis is well adapted to arid conditions and is often found in exposed environments.
